description: From Ancient Greek χθόνιος (khthónios, “in or under the ground”), from χθών (khthṓn, “ground”).

adjectives.description: chthonian (not generally comparable, comparative more chthonian, superlative most chthonian)

entries.meaning: Pertaining to the underworld; being beneath the earth.
examples: ...I intend to apply the name chthonian to all gods and spirits of the earth, whether their functions are concerned with agriculture or with the grave and the world beyond, or (as often) with both.

entries.meaning: A dweller in the mythical underworld.
